days.notes: Jet lag recovery day - light schedule with iconic Chongqing attractions

attractions.name: 下浩里 (Xiahao Old Street)
attractions.location: 南滨路与东水门长江大桥交叉口东北角
attractions.notes: Free historic riverside neighborhood with waterfalls, newly renovated area near Raffles. Walking distance from hotel.
attractions.english_friendly: Medium - Signage in Chinese, visual exploration

attractions.name: 湖广会馆 (Huguang Guild Hall)
attractions.notes: Historic guild hall complex with traditional architecture. Ticket required.
attractions.english_friendly: Low - Mostly Chinese exhibits, hire English guide recommended

attractions.name: 重庆长江索道 (Yangtze River Cable Car)
attractions.location: 北站: 新华路151号 / 南站: 上新街4号
attractions.notes: Iconic cable car crossing the Yangtze River. Book tickets online to skip queues. North station near Raffles, ride to South station for city views.
attractions.english_friendly: High - Simple ticket process, minimal language needed

attractions.name: 洪崖洞民俗风貌区 (Hongya Cave Folk Custom Area)
attractions.notes: Famous stilted building complex, best viewed at night when illuminated. Multiple levels with shops and restaurants. Free entry.
attractions.english_friendly: Medium - Tourist-friendly, some English signage

attractions.name: Raffles Chongqing Observation Deck
attractions.notes: Free observation deck in Raffles complex offering panoramic city views. Convenient as staying at hotel.
attractions.english_friendly: High - International hotel standard

attractions.name: 龙门浩老街 (Longmenhao Old Street)
attractions.notes: Restored riverside historic district near Xiahao, good for photos. Free entry, underground parking available.
attractions.english_friendly: Medium - Visual exploration, some English in shops

attractions.name: 李子坝站轨道穿楼 (Liziba Station - Train Through Building)
attractions.notes: Famous light rail station where metro passes through residential building. Free observation platform. Photo spot.
attractions.english_friendly: High - Outdoor viewing platform, no interaction needed

attractions.name: Chongqing Drone Show
attractions.notes: Seasonal drone light shows over Yangtze River. Check local schedule for Feb 15, 2026. Usually visible from Hongya Cave area or South Bank.
attractions.english_friendly: High - Visual show, no language barrier

days.notes: Brief morning sightseeing in Bazhong before train to Chengdu

attractions.name: 南龛坡 (Nankan Slope)
attractions.notes: Local scenic area with historic significance. Free entry. Choose this OR Wangwang Mountain (not both due to time).
attractions.english_friendly: Low - Local attraction, Chinese only

attractions.name: 望王山 (Wangwang Mountain) - ALTERNATIVE
attractions.notes: Local mountain park with observation deck and temple (Wang Wang Temple). Free entry. Alternative to Nankan Slope.
attractions.english_friendly: Low - Local attraction, Chinese only

attractions.name: 成都太古里 (Chengdu Taikoo Li)
attractions.notes: Upscale open-air shopping and dining district. Evening exploration after arriving in Chengdu. Mix of international and local brands.
attractions.english_friendly: High - International shopping area, English signage common

days.notes: Morning panda visit and Jinli before afternoon flight

attractions.name: 成都大熊猫繁育研究基地 (Chengdu Research Base of Giant Panda Breeding)
attractions.notes: MUST arrive at 09:00 opening time to see pandas most active. Plan 1-2 hours max. Book tickets online (official website or Trip.com). Early morning is best for panda activity.
attractions.english_friendly: High - Major tourist site, English signage and audio guides available

attractions.name: 锦里古街 (Jinli Ancient Street)
attractions.notes: Traditional style pedestrian street next to Wuhou Temple. Famous for Sichuan snacks and souvenirs. Free entry. Good for quick lunch/snacks before flight.
attractions.english_friendly: Medium - Tourist area, some English, mostly visual navigation

attractions.name: 外滩 (The Bund) - Evening
attractions.notes: Iconic Shanghai waterfront after evening arrival. Best viewed at night with illuminated buildings. Walking distance from SK Hotel.
attractions.english_friendly: High - International landmark, English signage

attractions.name: 南京路步行街 (Nanjing Road Pedestrian Street)
attractions.notes: Famous shopping street connecting to The Bund. Evening stroll after hotel check-in. Near SK Hotel location.
attractions.english_friendly: High - Major tourist street, multilingual

days.notes: INFJ-style niche exploration: cute toy stores, English bookstores, cozy cafes - REQUIRES REDNOTE RESEARCH

attractions.name: People's Square Area Exploration
attractions.notes: Central Shanghai area with access to bookstores, cafes, and niche shops. Start point for INFJ-style exploration. PLACEHOLDER - Detailed spots to be researched via RedNote for: Popmart-style toy stores, English independent bookstores, cozy cafes, niche/fancy boutiques.
attractions.english_friendly: High - Central tourist area

attractions.name: PLACEHOLDER: Cute Toy Stores (Popmart-style)
attractions.notes: RESEARCH NEEDED via RedNote: 上海盲盒店推荐, 上海小众玩具店, Popmart Shanghai locations. Girlfriend interested in cute collectibles.
attractions.english_friendly: Medium-High

attractions.name: PLACEHOLDER: English Independent Bookstores
attractions.notes: RESEARCH NEEDED via RedNote: 上海英文书店, Shanghai independent bookstores. Important for girlfriend (A1 Chinese level).
attractions.english_friendly: High - English bookstores

attractions.name: PLACEHOLDER: Cozy Cafes (INFJ-friendly)
attractions.notes: RESEARCH NEEDED via RedNote: 上海小众咖啡馆, 上海安静咖啡店, INFJ personality prefers quiet, aesthetic, non-crowded spaces.
attractions.english_friendly: Medium-High

attractions.name: 上海迪士尼乐园 (Shanghai Disneyland)
attractions.notes: Full day theme park. Book tickets online in advance (official app or Trip.com). Arrive at opening (08:30-09:00). Download Shanghai Disney Resort app for wait times and FastPass. Peak ticket price ~599 RMB (Feb 2026 may be Spring Festival period - check pricing). Metro Line 11 to Disneyland station.
attractions.english_friendly: High - International resort, full English support

days.notes: Free day - continue niche exploration and remaining dining

attractions.name: Additional Niche Exploration
attractions.notes: Continue INFJ-style niche spots from Day 5. Visit any remaining bookstores, cafes, or boutiques. Shopping for fashion items if interested. RESEARCH NEEDED via RedNote for backup recommendations.
attractions.english_friendly: Medium-High

days.notes: First full weekend day in Beijing - major attractions

attractions.name: 故宫博物院 (Forbidden City)
attractions.notes: MUST book tickets online 10 days in advance (official website: gugong.228.com.cn or WeChat mini-program). Limited daily capacity. Enter from Meridian Gate (午门), exit from north gate. Audio guide available in English. Allow 3-4 hours minimum. Closed Mondays.
attractions.english_friendly: High - Major tourist site, English audio guides and signage

attractions.name: 南锣鼓巷 (Nanluoguxiang)
attractions.notes: Traditional Beijing hutong (alley) area with cafes, shops, and bars. Good for evening after Forbidden City. Metro Line 6/8 to Nanluoguxiang station. Free to explore.
attractions.english_friendly: High - Popular tourist hutong, English menus common

attractions.name: 798艺术区 (798 Art District)
attractions.notes: Former factory complex turned contemporary art zone. Free to walk around, individual galleries may charge admission (20-50 RMB). Many cafes and restaurants. Best on weekends for openings and events. Takes taxi/subway + walk.
attractions.english_friendly: High - International art scene, English common

days.notes: Sunday - flexible for Forbidden City if not done, or Tianjin day trip

attractions.name: Optional: Tianjin Day Trip
attractions.notes: OPTIONAL day trip if interested. High-speed train 30-35 min from Beijing South Station. See Italian Style Street, Tianjin Eye Ferris Wheel, Ancient Culture Street. Return same day. Alternative: use this day for Forbidden City if not done on Day 14.
attractions.english_friendly: Medium - Less English than Beijing

days.notes: Weekday - university campus exploration, establish girlfriend's comfort zone

attractions.name: Tsinghua University Campus Tour
attractions.notes: Campus tour to help girlfriend familiarize with area. May require ID/reservation to enter. Beautiful campus with lake and historic buildings. Walk around nearby Wudaokou area for restaurants and student life.
attractions.opening_hours: Campus visiting hours vary, check restrictions
attractions.english_friendly: Medium - University campus, some English signage

attractions.name: Peking University Campus Tour
attractions.notes: Historic campus tour, including Weiming Lake. May require advance online booking for campus entry. Nearby Wudaokou area good for exploring restaurants and facilities.
attractions.opening_hours: Campus visiting hours vary, check restrictions
attractions.english_friendly: Medium - University campus, some English signage

notes: IMPORTANT RESEARCH GAPS: Shanghai Day 5 & 7 require detailed RedNote research for INFJ-style niche spots (cute toy stores like Popmart, English independent bookstores, cozy cafes, fancy boutiques). Beijing attractions assume rental apartment location TBD - adjust transportation notes once address confirmed. Forbidden City tickets must be booked 10 days in advance. Some attractions may have Spring Festival (Chinese New Year) schedule changes around Feb 15-20, 2026 - verify closer to dates.
booking_requirements: Forbidden City: Book 10 days advance online (gugong.228.com.cn)
Shanghai Disneyland: Book tickets in advance via official app or Trip.com
Giant Panda Base Chengdu: Book online, arrive by 09:00 for active pandas
Yangtze Cable Car: Online booking recommended to skip queues
University campus visits (Tsinghua/Peking): May require online reservation
weather_considerations: Chengdu (Feb 17-18): 5-12°C, cooler mornings at Panda Base - layers needed
Shanghai (Feb 18-22): 5-10°C, cold and potentially rainy - winter coat
Beijing (Feb 22-Mar 7): -2 to 8°C, cold and dry - heavy winter clothing required
